title: Frank Lampard reserves special praise for ‘outstanding’ Mateo Kovacic after Chelsea beat Newcastle
text:
Frank Lampard’s Chelsea beat Newcastle United at Stamford Bridge (Picture: Getty)

Frank Lampard hailed Mateo Kovacic as ‘outstanding’ after Chelsea beat Newcastle United 1-0 to secure their fifth successive win in all competitions.

The Blues were frustrated for 70 minutes by Steve Bruce’s Newcastle, with in-form striker Tammy Abraham hitting the bar and Christian Pulisic denied by Martin Dubravka.

But they finally turned their pressure into a lead when left-back Marcos Alonso rifled home with 17 minutes remaining.

Abraham looked set to settle the affair late on and, while his effort was brilliantly blocked by DeAndre Yedlin, Newcastle were unable to find an equaliser.

Lampard said Mateo Kovacic was ‘outstanding’ in the Premier League clash (Picture: Getty)

The 1-0 win sees Chelsea move up to third in the Premier League, while Newcastle – who beat Manchester United prior to the international break – drop back into the relegation zone.

Speaking to the media after the match, Lampard said: ‘First of all, I’ve got to give credit to Newcastle. You can see why they have got results this year.

‘In the first half we were a little safe and slow… there was not enough urgency or risk. That was the message at half-time.

Marcos Alonso secured the three points for Chelsea with a second-half strike (Picture: Getty)

‘We saw the spirit and energy of the team in the second half. We just need to keep picking up the wins and take nothing for granted.

‘We had a problem in the game, but solved it. Kovacic was outstandinge. I am pleased, we have to play like that. We got our way in the end.’

Chelsea return to action on Wednesday night when they face Champions League rivals Ajax in Amsterdam.
